top_stories.summary: arXiv:2602.11761v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: The evolution of large language models (LLMs) towards applications with ultra-long contexts faces challenges posed by the high computational and memory costs of the Transformer architecture. top_stories.title: [Archive] Bi-Level Prompt Optimization for Multimodal LLM-as-a-Judge
top_stories.summary: arXiv:2602.11340v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large language models (LLMs) have become widely adopted as automated judges for evaluating AI-generated content. top_stories.summary: arXiv:2602.11455v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Reinforcement Learning with Verifiable Rewards (RLVR) has significantly advanced the reasoning capabilities of Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs), yet how visual evidence is integrated during reasoning remains poorly understood. top_stories.title: [Archive] scPilot: Large Language Model Reasoning Toward Automated Single-Cell Analysis and Discovery
top_stories.summary: arXiv:2602.11609v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We present scPilot, the first systematic framework to practice omics-native reasoning: a large language model (LLM) converses in natural language while directly inspecting single-cell RNA-seq data and on-demand bioinformatics tools. scPilot converts core single-cell analyses, i.e., cell-type annotatio

top_stories.title: [Archive] Do MLLMs Really Understand Space? A Mathematical Reasoning Evaluation
top_stories.summary: arXiv:2602.11635v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Multimodal large language models (MLLMs) have achieved strong performance on perception-oriented tasks, yet their ability to perform mathematical spatial reasoning, defined as the capacity to parse and manipulate two- and three-dimensional relations, remains unclear.
